result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan J Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**2 days credit if probation revoked.**  *Cases 21CM690, 21CM779, 21CM1032 dismissed and read in.*

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: With case 22CM267.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan J Berry

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Attachment

(10:03 AM cases 21CM690, 21CM779, 21CM1032, 22CM267, 22CM414 called.) Defendant Jordan J Berry in court. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Jordan J Berry. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22TR3514 Count 1: OWI 1st Offense, 22CM414 Count 1: Misdemeanor Bail Jumping and 22CM267 Count 4: Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500).
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and find the defendant Guilty of 22TR3514 Count 1, 22CM414 Count 1 and 22CM267 Count 1.

Court orders sentences as follows:
Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years on 22CM414 Count 1 and 22CM267 Count 1 with the following conditions:
60 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on 22CM414 Count 1. No contact with C.L. or C.L.'s residence without prior written permission from C.L. and the probation agent. Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. Restitution in the amount of $298.00 plus 5% and 10% surcharges. Complete a Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any recommendations. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 2 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including cases 21CM690, 21CM779, 21CM1032, 22TR3512, 22TR3513 are dismissed and read in. 

Court orders sentence on 22TR3514 Count 1:
$811.50 forfeiture/costs. Mayo Hospital blood draw fee. 6 month driver's license revocation. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Court orders any revocation is retroactive.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cases called at 10:03 AM: 21CM690, 21CM779, 21CM1032, 22CM267, 22CM414
Defendant Jordan J Berry appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Jordan J Berry.  Attorney Afton Lewis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached.  Attorney Cook requests adjournment to review the plea paperwork with the Defendant.
STC: 9/15/22 at 10:00 AM (in person).
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:27 AM Cases called: 21CM690, 21CM779, 21CM1032, 22CM267 & 22CM414. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan J Berry appeared by audio.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Jordan J Berry. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. 

Defendant enters not guilty pleas in all cases and on all counts. Court accepts pleas and refers cases to Br. 3 for scheduling.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward

Defendant Jordan J Berry appeared via Zoom  by audio only.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Jordan J Berry. Defendant ordered to get fingerprints completed. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 07/18/22 at 2pm
Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward
